column4: and how do I access it... the only reason is that I am trying to install firefox 1.0.4, instead of 1.0.2 that is already installed with Ubuntu... and when I link the the directory /user/lib/mozilla-firefox/ I get the message that I am not allowed to install in this directory since I don't have administrative privileges.
you don't need 1.0.4 - the ubuntu one is up to date
will for instance if you have firefox 1.0.2 you can not install extensions...
if you have issues with themes and extensions, go to about:config and edit the vendorSub string to be 1.0.4
the problem is that I don't want to have firefox released form Ubuntu I wanted to have it installed from source from Mozilla.
why?
http://www.google.com.au/search?hl=en&q=site%3A+ubuntulinux.org+%22samba%22&btnG=Google+Search&meta=
no - use apt or synaptic to install packages (totem-xine is there)
#flood or pastebin.com, please
don't paste in the channel
pasting in the cahannel is spam
that's why I said please use #flood or pastebin.com
heheh - yes but it's usually silent as he grave ;)
this is "Freenode" - windows kind of doesn't fit the picture...
and this is on-topic how ? *grin*
like what ?
no, we all use slackware ;)
